English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, will I ever\nknow you completely?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 나는 널 온전히 알 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): What do you mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 무슨 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): I will always be me.\nAnd you will always be you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 항상 나일 거야. 넌 항상 너일 테고.

English (United States)(en-US): Right. And?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그렇지?

English (United States)(en-US): I will eternally, solely, be \nnothing more than myself...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 언제나, 오로지, 그리고\n‘고작’ 나일 수밖에 없으며...

English (United States)(en-US): (Mull it over. Dot has a point.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (곰곰이 생각한다. 맞는 말이야.)

English (United States)(en-US): I will never ever... be you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결코... ‘네’가 될 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I want to\nhear it from you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너의 입으로 답을 듣고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): Can the way the blush of the sunset captures my\nheart and echoes in yours... be one and the same?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 노을의 붉음이 내 마음을 사로잡는 감각과\n너의 마음을 울리는 감각이... 같을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Not entirely.|We can try.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 똑같지는 않겠지.|노력해 볼 수는 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): We may be looking at the same sunset in the\nsame moment, but we’re still different beings.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 같은 순간을 공유하며 같은 노을을 바라보고\n있어도, 우린 엄연히 다른 존재니까.

English (United States)(en-US): While you’re entranced by how\nEarth’s waves are tinged with orange,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 주황빛을 머금고 반짝이는 지구의\n파도와 주변 풍경에 매료되어 있을 때,

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be absorbing the rich sunlight\nand gazing at the ripe sunset.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 풍요로운 햇살을 피부로 느끼며\n다 익은 노을빛을 바라보고 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And your sunset and my sunset... will\nsettle within us as individual experiences.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 너의 노을과 나의 노을은... 각기\n다른 경험이 되어 너와 나에게 안착하겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): There are times I want to send\nyou my sunset in its entirety.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 노을을 너에게 그대로\n전달해 주고 싶을 때도 있는데.

English (United States)(en-US): But it just can’t be transmitted.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러나 마음은 복사되지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): A bluetooth for feelings has yet to be invented...|(Nod quietly while listening.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음 전용 블루투스는 아직 발명이...|(뭉치의 말을 듣다 조용히 끄덕인다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Anyways.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 크흠.

English (United States)(en-US): We can try.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 노력해 볼 수는 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): We may be different beings, but we’ll still look at\nthe same sunset within the same moment.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우린 엄연히 다른 존재지만, 같은 순간을\n공유하며 같은 노을을 바라보고 있으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): If you explain the senses etched clearly\nin you with your unique language
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너만의 언어로, 네 안에 울려퍼지는\n감각을 잘 설명해 준다면

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be able to search for something\nlike it within my own senses,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 내 감각들 속에서 너의 감각과 유사할지\n모르는 느낌을 찾아 볼 수 있을 테고,

English (United States)(en-US): and we’ll meet each other\nat a certain point.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 분명 어느 한 접점에서 마주쳐 통하게 될 수 있겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, if only I could believe\nyou and your every word.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 정말이지 그 말을 곧이곧대로\n믿을 수만 있다면 얼마나 좋을까.

English (United States)(en-US): I examine your face with keen eyes\nbecause I want to know you better.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 너를 더 알고 싶어서,\n유심한 눈으로 네 표정을 관찰해.

English (United States)(en-US): And I hope to myself that\nyour eyes are as clear as glass.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 네 눈빛이 유리조각만큼은\n투명하기를 바라겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But they’re just dark pools.\nI can’t gaze within.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 눈 속은 그저 검을 뿐이야. 마음 같은 게 보이지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): (You stare into Dot’s eyes.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치의 눈을 가만히 바라본다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Likewise, you cannot spy\nany ‘echoes of the heart’.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (역시 ‘마음 속 감정의 울림’ 같은 건 보이지 않는다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (All you can guess from their expression\nand words is that Dot is very sad.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치가 아주 슬프다는 것을 표정과\n말을 통해 유추해 볼 수 있을 뿐.)

English (United States)(en-US): And that makes you anxious and troubled.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 널 불안하고 어렵게 만드는구나.

English (United States)(en-US): That you might not know the\nother’s feelings, much less the other.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 상대의 마음을, 나아가 상대를 정확하게 알 수 없을까 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. To blindly trust that the surface you select\nand reveal is similar to what lies underneath...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 그저 네가 습관적으로 선별해 보여 주는\n표면들이 너의 내면과 가장 닮아 있으리라 믿으며...

English (United States)(en-US): and guess who you are is my second best,\nand second worst option simultaneously.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 널 유추하고 짐작하는 게 최선인 동시에 차악인 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): But you live and breathe as an\namorphous, dimensional being.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다만 넌 비정형의 입체로 살아 숨쉬어.

English (United States)(en-US): You don’t exist as temporary surfaces.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 순간순간 내어 보이는 표면 따위로 존재하는 게 아니지.

English (United States)(en-US): So we... won’t ever be able to\nreach each other underneath.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 영원히... 우리는 서로의\n내면 세계에 가닿지 못할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I guess your logic is sound.\nBut... to put it in a human way,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 근본적으로 접근하면 맞는 논리야.\n 하지만... 인간의 경우로 설명해 주자면,

English (United States)(en-US): we use language to convey as precisely as\npossible what lies underneath and cannot be perceived.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 미지의 내면을 타인에게 최대한 근접하게\n설명해 주기 위해 언어로서 대화를 나눠.

English (United States)(en-US): Just like you and I promised. To describe our\nemotions in an intricate and unchained language,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리도 약속했었잖아. 섬세하고 자유로운\n언어로 서로의 감정을 잘 알 수 있게 표현하고

English (United States)(en-US): and work to draw closer through\na series of questions and answers.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 질문과 답변의 행위로 더욱 친해지기 위해 노력하자고.

English (United States)(en-US): No. No. I know. I know, but.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니야. 아니야. 알지만. 알지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But, <nickname>. Last night a vivid\nrealization struck my heart like a knife.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만, <nickname>, 어젯밤의 몽상 속에서 내\n마음을 강타했던 칼날 같은 깨달음이 하나 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): That no matter how intricate words are, they\naren’t enough to contain you and your infinities.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 세심한 언어일지라도, 그보다 훨씬\n방대한 너를 담아 내기에는 역부족인걸.

English (United States)(en-US): And... perhaps the surface is disguised\nto look nothing like what lies beneath.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고... 마음과 다른 표면을\n꾸며 내었는지도 모를 일이지.

English (United States)(en-US): I have faith that’s not the case\nwith you... but it’s a blind one.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 그러지 않을 거라 믿지만... 이건\n그저 눈가리개를 찬 믿음일 뿐이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): So just by observing the surface I won’t be able\nto gaze into your heart, or cross over to it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 난 결코 표면을 관찰하는 것만으로는 네 마음속을\n들여다볼 수도, 그 경계를 넘어갈 수도 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I won’t ever get to know you by being you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결코 ‘네가 되어 보는’ 방식으로\n너를 알아갈 수는 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): That will forever lie\nbeyond my grasp...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 영영 불가능할 거야...

English (United States)(en-US): (But solitude in its essence can’t be resolved.)|(... I can understand that solitude.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (하지만 근본적인 고독이란 원래 채워질 수 없는 거잖아.)|(... 그 갑갑한 고독을 나 역시 알 것 같아.)

English (United States)(en-US): I remember a conversation\nwe once had.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 언제 이런 말을 나누었었지.

English (United States)(en-US): That some desires can’t be solved or fulfilled.\nThat sometimes bearing it is the only option.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 채우거나 충족할 수 없는 마음도 있다고.\n그럴 땐 견디는 것만이 유일한 길이라고.

English (United States)(en-US): We’ll bear it. The wall may be unbreakable,\nbut someday we’ll learn to deal with it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 견딜 수 있을 거야. 깨지지 않는 벽이지만,\n언젠가 그 벽을 다루는 법을 알게 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Time will pass, and we may draw closer\nthen ever in spite of the wall in between.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간이 흐른 뒤, 벽을 사이에 둔 채로도\n가장 가까워진 우리를 볼 수 있을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): So give us time to grow closer.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 너와 내가 가까워질 수 있는 시간을 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): Fruitless desires. Blind faith.\nNothing is ever certain, is it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 헛된 갈망. 눈가리개를 찬 희망. 결국\n확실한 건 아무것도 없는 것이구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel that way too sometimes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가끔 나에게도 그런 순간이 찾아와.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel stuck sometimes. Even when I’m next\nto someone that’s intimate and like me...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 답답해서 가슴이 턱 막히는. 아무리\n친밀하고 비슷한 사람 옆에 있더라도...

English (United States)(en-US): If only there were someone so like me that to\nread me would be like breathing, and vice versa,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너무 닮아서 나를 자연히 독해하고, 나\n역시 그를 독해할 수 있는 타인이 있다면,

English (United States)(en-US): then I wouldn’t have to explain myself so\nthoroughly. I would be accepted as I am.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 나를 열심히 설명하며 살지 않아도 될 텐데.\n그 역시 온전히 이해받을 수 있을 텐데.

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes maintaining relationships can\nbe tiring, and lonely. I know how you feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 때로는 관계를 이어간다는 게 아주 피곤하기도,\n아주 외롭기도 하지. 뭉치의 마음을 공감해.

English (United States)(en-US): There is no hope, is there.\nYou feel the same pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결국 희망은 없구나. 너도 같은 통증을 느낄 뿐이구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m stuck. Stuck. Stuck. Stuck.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 답답해. 답답해. 답답해. 답답해.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m losing it. I want to know. I have to\nknow. I need to be closer, closer, closer.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미칠 것 같아. 알고 싶어. 알고 싶어.\n더, 더, 더 가까워지고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, oh... No.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 아... 아니.

English (United States)(en-US): All individual beings have\nlonely fates. I have to know this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 고유한 존재들에는 필연적인\n외로움이 있어. 알아야만 해.

English (United States)(en-US): But I’m so scared.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만 정말로 무서운걸.

English (United States)(en-US): That we may remain strangers forever\nonly to be forgotten, then wither and die...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우린 서로에게 영원한 이방인으로 남은\n채 잊히다가, 메말라 죽어 버릴지 몰라...

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe even after\nI become a dream...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 꿈이 된 후에도...

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you’re here.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 왔구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you feel better?|Have you found your answer?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기분은 괜찮아졌어?|고민은 해결됐어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, the anxiety has passed and I’ve\nfound peace. But I’m sad and troubled.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 불안이 가시며 마음의 평화를\n되찾았어. 하지만 슬프고 착잡해.

English (United States)(en-US): Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): I have decided to leave you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 너를 떠나기로 했거든.

English (United States)(en-US): (Stunned.)|(Ask why.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 놀라서 아무 말 하지 않는다.|이유를 물어본다

English (United States)(en-US): Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): You are my only and\nmost unique being.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 넌 나에게 유일하고도\n가장 고유한 존재인데.

English (United States)(en-US): And I believed that by resonating\nwith you from a very close distance,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 아주 가까운 거리에서 공명하며,

English (United States)(en-US): we could be fulfilled together.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 함께 충만해질 수 있을 거라\n굳게 믿고 있었는데.

English (United States)(en-US): But if I can never go within\nyou, and beyond your seas,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 네 안, 네 바다 너머로\n결코 들어갈 수 없다면,

English (United States)(en-US): if I can never resonate with\nyou and know you wholly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너를 결코 온전히 아는\n채로 공명할 수 없다면

English (United States)(en-US): ... And if that truth will never change,\nthen I can no longer stay by your side.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그리고 그게 진리라면, 더 이상\n너의 옆에 있을 자신이 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): It hurts to be let down, you see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기대가 깨지는 건 아주 아픈 일이거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Where will you go?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 떠나서 어디로 갈 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s dangerous out there.|You’re leaving... just like that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바깥은 너무 위험해.|그냥... 이렇게 떠나는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): You might find a new home, but you might\nalso slip into a muddy pool and dissolve.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다른 집을 찾을 수 있을지도 모르고,\n고여 있던 구정물에 빠져 녹아 버릴 수도 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I’m not leaving\nin search of a new place.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 내가 떠나는 이유는 다른\n곳으로 가기 위함이 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): I just can’t stay here any more.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이곳에 남아 있지 못해서야.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought you would at least talk\nthings out. I thought we were friends.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이야기하지도 않고 혼자 결정할 줄은\n몰랐어. 나는 우리가 친구라고 생각했거든.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I’m not leaving because we’re not.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 내가 떠나는 이유는 너를\n친구로 생각하지 않아서가 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps I’m leaving because you’re\ntoo good of a friend to me...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너무 좋은 친구로 생각하기\n때문에 떠나는 것일지도...

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you can’t understand the dark well\nwithin me, can you? You’re... beautiful. Human.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너는 내 안의 시커먼 우물을 이해할\n수 없겠지? 넌... 아름다운 인간이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps a fellow creature will\nresonate with me more intimately.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 나와 더욱 긴밀히 공명할\n존재는, 나와 같은 괴물 친구.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m not as perfect as you think...|I think humans are no different from creatures.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 너의 생각만큼 무결한 존재가 아니야...|인간과 괴물은 다를 바가 없다고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes I feel like there’s\na dark well within me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가령, 내 마음 속에도 시커먼 우물이\n고여 있는 것처럼 느껴질 때가 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): It may be different from the emotions\nthat causes you to despise yourself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 검정이 너를 징그럽게 여기도록\n하는 감각과는 다를 수 있겠지만

English (United States)(en-US): But in some way\nyou and I are alike.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비슷한 결로서는 나도 너와 닮아 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): We are all alike in some way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 모두 서로 닮아 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): But I wanted to be your dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 나는 너의 꿈이 되고 싶었단 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): What about it?|Do we have to be the same for you to be mine?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 왜?|꿈이 되려면 너와 내가 같아야만 해?

English (United States)(en-US): When you dream of me at night, I’ll\nlive in your head when morning comes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 밤 동안 꿈으로 변한 나를 꾸면, 그날\n아침부터 난 네 머릿속에 살게 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): There, I’ll sit in a small dark corner...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳에도 나를 위한 작고\n어둑한 모퉁이가 있겠지...

English (United States)(en-US): And I’ll be your friend forever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 그곳에서 너의 영원한 친구가 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): (It’s Dot’s way of saying that is how\nthey’ll stay in my memory and heart.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치는 기억과 마음 속에\n남는다는 걸 이렇게 표현하는구나.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Dreams can be romantic like this.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (꿈이 굉장히 낭만적인 존재처럼 느껴지네.)

English (United States)(en-US): But.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데

English (United States)(en-US): But even after I make\nthat irreversible choice,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 만약 그 돌이킬 수\n없는 선택을 내려 버린 후에도,

English (United States)(en-US): what if after I become your dream,\nbeyond your seas and the wall,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 된 후에도 내가 네\n바다 너머, 벽 너머에서

English (United States)(en-US): I’m reminded every single day\nthat we can never be completely us,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리가 완전한 우리가 될 수\n없다는 것을 매일 매일 상기당하며

English (United States)(en-US): and forced to scratch the surface of the wall\nand talk to myself? Forever? Alone? Perilously?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 벽의 표면만을 긁으며 평생을 혼잣말해야 \n한다면? 평생을? 고독하고? 위태롭게?

English (United States)(en-US): ..... (What?)|I’m not following.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ..... (무슨 뜻이지?)|비유가 난해해서 이해하기 어려워.

English (United States)(en-US): ..... What?
... It’s alright. It doesn’t matter if you don’t\nunderstand. Perhaps if you were a creature.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 괜찮아. <nickname>, 이해를 바라고 한 말은 아니었어.\n네가 아닌 괴물 친구였다면 단박에 알아들어 주었겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, you and I are different.\nWe can never be one.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 너와 나는 다른 존재야.\n영원히 하나될 수 없는.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe that’s all there\nis to our relationship.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 그게 관계의 본질일지도 모르지.

English (United States)(en-US): But...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만...

English (United States)(en-US): It’s that we’re different that makes\nus beautiful.It’s all a matter of will.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결국 우리는 달라서 아름다운 거야.|결국 중요한 건 의지라고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐?

English (United States)(en-US): Think of a harmony.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 화음을 생각해 보자.

English (United States)(en-US): At times our melodies may slip and\ncreate an unpleasant dissonance.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 각자의 음을 노래하다가도 때로는 삐끗해서\n듣기 싫은 불협화음이 될 수도 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): But it’s still our song.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 그게 우리의 노래인걸.

English (United States)(en-US): It doesn’t always have to be beautiful,\nas long as you and I tune it together
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매순간 아름답지 않아도, 너와 내가\n함께 노래를 만들기 위해 음을 조율하고

English (United States)(en-US): and try to move each other with\na carefully drawn-out melody.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조심스럽게 음을 내어\n서로를 울리려 하는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): To focus on your melody, the way it differs from\nmine, and simply feel it. That matters to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나와는 다른 너의 음을 귀 기울여 듣고, 그저 느껴\n보려 하는 마음. 난 그게 값진 거라고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): We’re different, and that’s what will make\nus try to read each other more thoroughly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 다르지만, 다르기에 서로를\n더욱 자세히 읽어 보려 할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Whether we’ve misread or\nunderstood is unimportant.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 중요한 건 이해를 했는지,\n오독을 하고 있는지가 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): The will to read each other.\nThat’s what matters.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 서로를 독해하려는 의지.\n그 의지만 중요한 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I understand what you mean.\nBut I’m still afraid.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 말은 잘 이해했어. 하지만\n난 여전히 두려워.

English (United States)(en-US): Afraid our ignorance and our\ndifference will rear its childish head.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리의 무지와 우리의 다름이\n미성숙한 횡포를 부릴까 겁나.

English (United States)(en-US): If I can’t bear the distance between\nus and scream to let myself be closer,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 우리 사이의 간극을 견디지 못해,\n너에게 가닿기 위해 소리를 질러 버린다면,

English (United States)(en-US): that sharp wave might\nchange you and I forever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 날카로운 파동이 너와 나의\n모양을 영영 바꿔 버린다면 어쩌지.

English (United States)(en-US): And what of my premeditated solitude,\none where I’ll walk across the empty time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이후의 텅 빈 시간 위를 혼자\n걸을 나의 예견된 고독은?

English (United States)(en-US): I know you’re worried. But\nnothing in the world is certain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불안할 것 알아. 그치만 세상에\n확실한 건 단 하나도 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Someone you love deeply\ncould be gone tomorrow.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깊이 사랑하던 사람이 내일이면\n곁을 떠날 수 있는 것처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s sad. But everything is\nand always will be a mystery.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 애석하지만 모든 게, 정말 모든 게 미지수야.

English (United States)(en-US): Nevertheless, Dot. Nevertheless.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 뭉치야, 하지만.

English (United States)(en-US): If we want to truly connect, we have to\nhave at least a little faith in each other.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇기에 우리가 관계를 맺고 살아가려면 \n서로를 조금이라도 믿어야 한다는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): The faith that one day\nwe’ll overcome this ignorance.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무지를 언젠가는 극복할 수 있다는 믿음,

English (United States)(en-US): That the way you look at me, at\nthe very least, is honest and true?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 날 바라볼 때의 눈빛만큼은\n진심을 그대로 투영할 것이라는 믿음 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, right. Even if we may witness\nthat faith crumbling at times,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 맞아. 종종 그 믿음이 무너지는 것을 목격할 때도

English (United States)(en-US): I still think it will live on somewhere.|I still think it’s important we rebuild it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리의 믿음은 어딘가에 여전히 존재한다고 생각해.|우리가 믿음을 다시 쌓아 가는 게 중요하다고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): So we put faith in others not because\nwe want to, but because we have to?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 타인을 ‘믿고 싶어서’가\n아니라 ‘믿기 위해서’ 믿는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): That’s one way of putting it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니라고 할 수가 없네.

English (United States)(en-US): Faith as the only solution... It’s too\nharsh a truth for my restless soul.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그저 믿는 것만이 유일한 해답이라니...\n내 불안 가득한 마음에겐 너무 가혹한 이치야.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know if this will help... but\ntime can help more often than not.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 위안이 될지는 모르겠지만...\n시간이 해결해 줄 때가 많기도 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Faith grows stronger with time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 믿음은 시간이 흐를수록 견고해지는 법이거든.

English (United States)(en-US): So I hope that you stay by my side, and\nobserve what happens to your faith.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 내 옆에서, 너의 믿음에 어떠한\n일이 일어나는지 지켜봤으면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): Just as long as your time with me\nis worth all the restlessness...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론 그 불안을 감당할 만큼\n나와의 시간이 즐거운 게 맞다면...

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t believe I made you worry\nabout something like that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 너에게 그런 걱정을 하게 하다니.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s worth it. It’s always been\nworth it, and it always will!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 즐거워. 한순간도 즐겁지 않았던 적 없었어!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, what have I almost done?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 내가 무슨 짓을 한 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): I was so afraid of fiction and the future that\nI almost pushed you, my dear friend, away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 허상과 미래를 두려워하느라 소중한\n친구인 너를 내 손으로 밀어낼 뻔했어.

English (United States)(en-US): When you, <nickname>, always\ntried to be my true friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너는 언제나 나의 진실된\n친구가 되어 주려고 노력했는데.

English (United States)(en-US): When I was comfortable and\nhappy during our time together.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 너와의 시간에서 가장 안락한\n즐거움을 느끼고 있었는데.

English (United States)(en-US): To have hurt you so...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 이렇게 돌이키기 힘든 상처를 주다니...

English (United States)(en-US): I really am no better than\na plastered gunk of tar.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이래서야 정말로 눌어붙은\n타르 덩어리와 다를 바 없잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): (They do look alike...)|(But smarter and cuter.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (비슷하게 생긴 건 맞는걸...)|(타르 덩어리보단 똑똑하고 귀여워.)

English (United States)(en-US): I’m sorry, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미안해, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): May I remain your sticky\ncreature friend as I have so far?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금처럼 너의 끈적끈적한 괴물 친구로 남아도 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): (Smile and nod.)|(Make fun of Dot.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (웃으며 끄덕인다.)|(장난을 친다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Silly Dot. Of course.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바보 괴물. 당연하지.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s how you learn.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이렇게 하나씩 배워 가는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Congratulations on dealing with distinctly\nhuman emotions in a creature’s body!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괴물의 몸으로서 지극히 인간적인\n감정 소모를 하게 된 걸 축하해!

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응!

English (United States)(en-US): Silly Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바보 괴물.

English (United States)(en-US): You can stay if you like,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 남는 건 자유지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but I’ll always be jealous of\nyour imaginary ‘creature friend’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 마음엔 네 상상 속 ‘괴물 친구’에\n대한 질투도 함께 남게 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): So brace yourself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 각오해.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh no...!
